title: A Shake-Up in the CFTC Chair Shortlist üåΩü™ë
content:
Discover more from Unchained
Your no-hype resource for all things crypto
Over 17,000 subscribers
By subscribing, I agree to Substack's Terms of Use, and acknowledge its Information Collection Notice and Privacy Policy.
Subscribe
Continue reading
Sign in
TRADGOV (PREVIOUSLY UNREGULATED)
A Shake-Up in the CFTC Chair Shortlist üåΩü™ë
The top two contenders have switched places.
VERONICA IRWIN
JAN 09, 2025
2
Share

Hey! I‚Äôm Veronica Irwin, Unchained‚Äôs regulatory reporter.

The CFTC Chair selection process has taken quite a while, hasn‚Äôt it?¬†

A month ago, we were the first to report that Brian Quintenz was the top contender, closely followed by Summer Mersinger. Several other outlets confirmed my reporting in the following days. At the time, it seemed all but certain that Trump would announce his pick for the role at any moment ‚Äî I spent all of the holiday break with Truth Social notifications on, jumping in my seat every time I received the alert that ‚Äú@realDonaldTrump just posted.‚Äù¬†

But as time went by, it became clearer and clearer that something was up. As it turns out, the Trump transition team is still researching who would be the best pick, diving deep into the contenders‚Äô backgrounds and gathering feedback.¬†

Not too much has changed in terms of who is in the running ‚Äî but the order by favorability has switched around.¬†

Crypto-Friendly Summer Mersinger Is Now the Top Contender for CFTC Chair
Summer Mersinger was a top aide to Senator Thune for 12 years (CFTC)

Sitting CFTC Commissioner Summer Mersinger is now the leading contender to chair the CFTC, according to five sources close to the deliberations.¬†

In the new year, Mersinger has gained an edge over the former favorite, a16z crypto Head of Policy Brian Quintenz, as she is seen as a choice who could help Trump curry favor with a Senate led by South Dakota Republican John Thune.¬†

Though the CFTC, which oversees commodities markets, often receives less attention than the SEC, which oversees securities, it could become the primary agency overseeing crypto within the next CFTC chair‚Äôs tenure. Previous iterations of a crypto market structure bill have made the CFTC crypto‚Äôs primary regulator, and policy advocates speculate that a similar bill could be passed before the midterm elections in two years.

Watch: Kristin Smith on Why This Is Crypto‚Äôs Time to ‚ÄòGet Policy Done‚Äô

Why Mersinger‚Äôs Name Has Risen to the Top

Mersinger has gained interest because of her ties to Senate Majority Leader John Thune, for whom she was a staffer from 2004 to 2016.¬†

Several of Trump‚Äôs cabinet nominees are facing tough confirmations in the Senate, sources explained, and appointing Mersinger could help Trump stay in Thune‚Äôs good graces.¬†

Additionally, because Mersinger is already a commissioner, she can simply be appointed to the interim chair position on January 20th, rather than needing to first go through the Senate confirmation process like Quintenz would as a private citizen. To become the permanent chair, however, she will need the Senate‚Äôs consent.¬†

Why Quintenz‚Äôs Fortunes Are Flagging¬†

Quintenz had been seen as the top contender before the holidays, largely because of his even closer ties to the industry due to his work at a16z crypto as well as his membership on the board of directors at prediction market Kalshi, a competitor to Polymarket.¬†

Read More: Who Will Be Trump‚Äôs CFTC Chair? There‚Äôs a New Top Contender for the Role

Sources who spoke with Unchained also assumed Quintenz had the backing of his boss Marc Andreessen, co-founder of the venture firm Andreessen Horowitz, of which a16z crypto is a part. Andreessen told The Free Press in December that he was spending about half of his time at Mar-a-Lago to help the incoming presidential administration. After Unchained first reported that Quintenz was the top contender, several other industry leaders supportive of Trump like Brian Armstrong and Chris Giancarlo said Quintenz would be a good choice for the industry.¬†

However, excitement around Quintenz has diminished, according to the same five sources who said Mersinger was in the lead. A 2018 speech by Quintenz has gained some attention from crypto advocates, in which Quintenz argued that even back-end developers of DeFi protocols could be held liable for CFTC violations if it was reasonably foreseeable at the time of their writing the code that the tools they were creating could be misused.¬†

Quintenz walked back the comments a few months later in a Coin Center blog post, and again clarified his stance in September 2023 on X. ‚ÄúThis speech did not contain my best thinking or most thought through arguments,‚Äù Quintenz explained. ‚ÄúI quickly revisited what I had said, admitted I was wrong, and published a new take that made it clear writing code should not be an offense.‚Äù¬†

Two sources also indicated that because another Andreessen pick, Sriram Krishnan, was given a position in the administration to oversee AI policy, the Trump transition team was less inclined to nominate another Silicon Valley favorite.¬†

Read More: Trump Announces Team Working With AI & Crypto Czar: What We Know

Mersinger‚Äôs Pro-Crypto History¬†

Mersinger, along with fellow conservative CFTC Commissioner Caroline Pham, has become known in the crypto industry for her dissents to crypto enforcement actions that were seen as excessive or unfair. In September, Mersinger, for example, called the CFTC‚Äôs fine on Uniswap for illegal digital asset derivatives trading ‚Äúregulation through enforcement‚Äù in September, criticizing the agency for failing to first provide clarity for DeFi protocols.¬†

She also issued a dissent on the CFTCs charges against Opyn, ZeroEx, and Deridex for failing to register with the agency and illegally offering retail commodity transactions and digital assets the year prior for similar reasons, arguing that the CFTC‚Äôs aggressive posture halted innovation and pushed crypto offshore.¬†¬†

At the Solidus-run Digital Asset Compliance and Market Integrity Summit (DACOM) conference in September, Mersinger told the audience that when crypto settlements come across her desk, she‚Äôs often ‚Äúlost the opportunity to have any influence,‚Äù and is ‚Äúleft with no other choice but to dissent.‚Äù¬†

The commissioner has been seen at several crypto conferences over the past year, including Consensus, DACOM, and, most recently, the Blockchain Association Policy Summit. The appearances signal that Mersinger stays in close conversation with industry executives and lobbyists. Several such executives and lobbyists who have met Mersinger at such events told Unchained that they considered Mersinger knowledgeable about blockchain technology and aligned with industry priorities.

Read More: Crypto Industry Braces for Wave of SEC, CFTC Actions as Fiscal Year Draws to a Close

Several other former CFTC officials, such as former commissioner Jill Sommers, former director of the market participants division Josh Sterling, and former Office of the General Counsel Neal Kumar, have also been vetted. Kraken Chief Legal Officer Marco Santori is also in the mix, according to three sources. CFTC Commissioner Pham is also in contention, though three sources indicate that she is also vying for a separate position at Treasury ‚Äî an interesting twist that could leave an additional conservative slot on the commission vacant.¬†

Sommers and representatives for the Trump-Vance transition team did not respond to a request for comment. Quintenz, Kumar, Sterling, and representatives for Pham, Andreessen, Santori, and Mersinger declined to comment.

Crypto Might Get Reality Check from Friendly U.S. Congress

Trump Announces Team Working With AI & Crypto Czar

Ohio Republican Senator Bernie Moreno to Serve on Influential Senate Banking Committee

JAN 09, 2025
1

Morning, morning, morning! I‚Äôm Juan Aranovich, managing editor of Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üí∞ U.S. gets nod to sell Silk Road bitcoin

üïí Mountains of evidence delay Do Kwon‚Äôs trial

üõ†Ô∏è Starknet boost for custom blockchains

üìä Binance‚Äôs user assets soar

Share your vision with Stellar‚Äôs Build Better initiative. Help shape blockchain‚Äôs future and enter to win from a $30,000 prize pool.

Learn More Here

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
U.S. Cleared to Sell $6.5B of Silk Road Bitcoin

The U.S. government has been authorized to sell some 69,000 BTC worth around $6.5 billion seized from dark web marketplace Silk Road.

That‚Äôs according to a report by DB News that cited an unnamed official as having said that permission for the sale had been granted by a federal judge.

The judicial ruling ends a years-long dispute as Battle Born Investments, which had purchased rights to the seized bitcoin through a bankruptcy estate connected to Silk Road, lost a bid to delay the sale, claiming that the Department of Justice was abusing the civil asset forfeiture process.

The DOJ had pushed for the sale on the grounds that bitcoin‚Äôs price was highly volatile.

Such sales may prove more difficult for government departments when the administration of incoming President Donald Trump takes charge.

Trump said in an interview in August that selling bitcoin is ‚Äúsomething [the U.S. government] shouldn't be doing because they [sic] should be trying to build it.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a very modern currency,‚Äù he said.

Learn more: What Is the History of the Silk Road in Crypto?

Do Kwon‚Äôs Criminal Trial to Begin in 2026

Terra co-founder Do Kwon‚Äôs criminal trial likely won‚Äôt begin until next January, as U.S. prosecutors expect to face significant delays in processing evidence.

Specifically, attorneys said they would need time to review six terabytes of data produced during discovery.

That review includes accessing encrypted information and unlocking four cellphones provided by Montenegrin authorities when Kwon was extradited. Some of the materials may need to be translated from Korean.

District Judge Paul Engelmayer said that scheduling the start date of a trial for more than a year from the initial conference was "unprecedented" in his career.

Engelmayer gave the defense one week to request an earlier trial this year.

Starknet Rolls Out Custom Blockchain Software Suite

Ethereum layer 2 scaling solution Starknet unveiled a new software suite named SN Stack, aimed at enabling developers to create custom blockchains using Starknet's zero-knowledge technology.

The new tool will allow developers to create validity rollup chains with customizable parameters such as block times and sizes, utilizing proven components of Starknet including Starknet OS, CairoVM, and the Blockifier execution engine.

SN Stack comes in three different configurations: a StarkWare sequencer that mirrors the public Starknet stack, app chain framework Madara and gaming-focused Dojo.

The launch positions Starknet as a competitor in the rollup stack market, alongside established players such as Optimism's OP Stack and Arbitrum's Orbit.

Binance User Assets Topped $160B in 2024

Binance, the world‚Äôs biggest crypto exchange, says 2024 was a record-breaking year as the custodial assets of its users topped $160 billion for the first time.

In an annual year-end report, the exchange reported having a quarter of a billion users last year, a 47% increase on the previous year.

That growth wasn‚Äôt limited to retail investors. Binance said the number of registered institutional users grew by 97% over the year.

The exchange‚Äôs cumulative historical trading volume now exceeds $100 trillion. The platform also said it processed a record 4.44 million requests per second last year.

Bits + Bips: Trump Will Soon Be President. Where Will Bitcoin and Crypto Prices Go?

Bitcoin‚Äôs strong start to 2025 raises questions about its sustainability as Trump‚Äôs inauguration, macro trends and Fed decisions shape the road ahead. Plus, James, Alex and guest Charles Edwards discuss whether AI agents will someday hire people.

In this episode, James Seyffart and Alex Kruger are joined by Charles Edwards of quant fund Capriole Investments to break down the macro trends shaping Bitcoin‚Äôs trajectory. From Trump‚Äôs inauguration to the Fed‚Äôs looming decisions on quantitative tightening, they analyze the key factors influencing risk assets. Plus, they unpack the premium on MicroStrategy‚Äôs BTC holdings, the future of AI agents in crypto and whether AI agent swarms might someday hire humans, and their bold predictions ‚Äîsupercycle? SOL ETFs?‚Äîfor 2025.

Listen to the episode on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Pods, Fountain, Podcast Addict, Pocket Casts, Amazon Music, or on your favorite podcast platform.

Daily Bits‚Ä¶ ‚úçÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è‚úç

‚ö° Decentralized perpetuals exchange Hyperliquid addressed decentralization criticisms, refuting claims of validator seat purchases while announcing plans for increased transparency and open-source node code once its system is secure.

üí• More than $500 million in crypto liquidations occurred within 24 hours, driven by heightened market volatility in bitcoin and ether prices, with long positions accounting for a significant portion of the losses.

üí® Solana pushed validators to test Frankendancer, an early iteration of its Firedancer upgrade that aims to boost blockchain speeds to an unprecedented one million transactions per second.

‚è≥ A federal judge postponed the sentencing of Avi Eisenberg, convicted for exploiting DeFi trading platform Mango Markets, to April 10, citing the case‚Äôs complexity and the need for an additional review of sentencing issues.

‚ùå FTX clarified that Backpack‚Äôs acquisition of its EU arm has not been court-approved, contradicting earlier claims by Backpack regarding creditor repayment authority and its readiness to operate.

üá∞üá∑ South Korea‚Äôs Financial Services Commission announced plans to lift restrictions on institutional crypto trading, signaling a gradual shift toward boosting institutional participation and supporting the local crypto industry.

üîé Outgoing Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler defended his crypto crackdown, reiterating the need for compliance in a sector he describes as ‚Äúrife with bad actors‚Äù while reflecting on regulatory progress during his time at the regulator‚Äôs helm.

Plus, ‚öñÔ∏è Coinbase chalks up a win, üí∞ Pump.fun cashes out more SOL, üåé Bitfinex Derivatives finds a new home, and more!
JUAN ARANOVICH
JAN 08, 2025
Share

Welcome to Wednesday! I‚Äôm Juan Aranovich, managing editor of Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üìâ Crypto market sheds $711M in BTC-led selloff

üèõÔ∏è Coinbase wins latest SEC battle but legal war rages on

üö® Pump.fun shifts millions to Kraken

Share your vision with Stellar‚Äôs Build Better initiative. Help shape blockchain‚Äôs future and enter to win from a $30,000 prize pool.

Learn More Here

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
Bitcoin Drops Below $97,000 as Liquidations Hit $711M

Only a day after it resumed trading above $101,000, bitcoin has dropped 6% to an intraday low of $95,521.

The negative price action comes amid a broader selloff in risk assets after the ISM Services Purchasing Managers‚Äô Index climbed higher, triggering a spike in Treasury yields as market participants began pricing in fewer rate cuts from the Federal Reserve this year.

Ethereum saw a steeper decline, falling 8.5% in 24 hours, while large-cap altcoins such as UNI, AVAX, and HYPE all saw double-digit percentage point declines.

The wider crypto market selloff triggered around $711 million of liquidations across major exchanges over the last day, according to data from crypto analytics platform CoinGlass.

Of the total sum liquidated, $631 million was from traders betting on higher prices, while shorts saw only $79 million of liquidations.

Photo by Yashowardhan Singh on Unsplash
Coinbase Wins Rare Appeal in SEC Case

Crypto exchange Coinbase has edged ahead in its legal battle with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over its alleged breaches of securities laws.

Judge Katherine Polk Failla granted Coinbase‚Äôs request for an interlocutory appeal on Jan. 7, effectively pausing the ongoing case.

Interlocutory appeals are not frequently granted, as courts generally disfavor the fragmentation of trials and prefer to address issues after trials are complete.

The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit will now determine whether the SEC‚Äôs allegations against Coinbase are valid under the country‚Äôs securities laws.

Photo by PiggyBank on Unsplash
Pump.fun Sends $20M SOL to Kraken

Solana memecoin marketplace Pump.fun appears to be cashing out more SOL as its fee account sent $20.49 million SOL to crypto exchange Kraken on Tuesday, according to data from onchain analytics platform Arkham.

The fee account still holds 15,721 SOL and 101,102 JitoSOL with a total value of around $27.2 million.

In addition to a 0.02 SOL issuance fee, Pump.Fun imposes a fee of 0.5% on each trade executed through its platform.

The fee is calculated before any slippage occurs, meaning that the actual amount deducted may vary slightly based on the value of the final trade.

It also does not include any additional fees that may be charged by the Solana network or other costs associated with the Pump.Fun bonding curve.

Photo by GuerrillaBuzz on Unsplash
Bitfinex Derivatives Is Moving to El Salvador

The derivatives trading arm of crypto exchange Bitfinex plans to relocate to Bitcoin-friendly El Salvador.

Bitfinex Derivatives announced the move on X, saying that it had secured a new digital asset service provider license in the Central American country.

‚ÄúThis move strengthens our mission to deliver innovative trading solutions, especially to underserved regions in Latin America,‚Äù Bitfinex said.

El Salvador adopted Bitcoin as legal tender in September 2021 and has since grown its reserves of the digital currency to 6,010 BTC.

ü§ù Arbitrum has deepened its partnership with South Korea‚Äôs Lotte Group, aiming to integrate blockchain infrastructure into the Caliverse metaverse platform, expanding the utility of Web3 payments for entertainment services.

JUAN ARANOVICH
JAN 07, 2025
1
1
Share

Hey, it‚Äôs Tuesday already! I‚Äôm Juan Aranovich, managing editor of Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üåç ‚ÄòMore than 1M‚Äô victims in Do Kwon case

‚öñÔ∏è Winklevoss twins settle CFTC suit

ü™ô Coinbase premium returns as BTC gains ground

üí∞ Buterin offloads memecoins in $2.5M charity boost

Share your vision with Stellar‚Äôs Build Better initiative. Help shape blockchain‚Äôs future and enter to win from a $30,000 prize pool.

Learn More Here

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
Do Kwon‚Äôs Victim Count May Top 1 Million, U.S. Prosecutors Say

The U.S. government estimates that the number of victims of Terra co-founder Do Kwon‚Äôs alleged fraud ‚Äúpotentially totals more than one million,‚Äù according to a recent filing to the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.

The sheer number of victims makes it ‚Äúimpracticable‚Äù for the court to ensure it accords all of the victims their rights under law, U.S. Attorney Daniel Gitner said.

The government intends to set up a website to inform potential victims of all public court proceedings. Victims that wish to be heard in court proceedings will be required to give prosecutors notice.

Do Kwon first appeared in court on Jan. 2 after he was extradited from Montenegro to the U.S. He pleaded not guilty to nine felony charges related to fraud.

Gemini to Pay $5M to Settle CFTC False Claims Suit

Gemini, the exchange run by identical twins and crypto investors Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, has agreed to pay a $5 million fine to settle a lawsuit with the U.S. Commodities and Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), according to a report by Bloomberg.

The suit, which the CFTC brought in June 2022, alleged that Gemini had made ‚Äúfalse and misleading statements‚Äù relating to the exchange‚Äôs bid to launch a Bitcoin futures contract.

Under a proposed consent order, Gemini agreed to settle the case without admitting or denying the allegations.

The consent order, still yet to be signed by a judge, will get the brothers out of a jury trial that was due to begin on Jan. 21.

Photo by Alexander Grey on Unsplash
Coinbase Premium Returns as Bitcoin Trades Above $101,000

Bitcoin‚Äôs rally past $101,800 has seen the Coinbase premium gap flip positive for the first time in three weeks, according to data shared by CryptoQuant analyst J.A. Maartunn.

The Coinbase premium measures the difference between the price of bitcoin on Coinbase and its price on non-U.S. exchanges such as Binance. It serves as an important indicator of market sentiment and buying pressure, particularly among American investors and institutions.

The other main gauge of U.S. sentiment is the amount of capital flowing into spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds, which also had a positive start to the week. The funds ended Monday with combined net inflows of more than $987 million, according to data from investment research platform SoSoValue.

Photo by Traxer on Unsplash
Vitalik Buterin Sells $2.5M of Memecoins to Fund His Charity

Vitalik Buterin is at it again. The Ethereum co-founder sold more memecoins on Monday, netting around $2.5 million in USDC and ETH, according to data from onchain analytics platform Arkham.

Buterin swapped tokens including DINU, ESTEE, and JSHIBA on trading platforms such as CoW Swap, Uniswap and Kyber Network. Since he began liquidating his holdings, DINU has lost nearly 51% of its value.

The tokens typically end up in Buterin‚Äôs wallet after being transferred to him by memecoin creators, who likely send them with the intent of gaining publicity.

As he has done in the past, Buterin donated the proceeds of his latest memecoin sale to fund his Kanro charity organization, according to onchain data.

Daily Bits‚Ä¶ ‚úçÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è‚úç

üí∞ MicroStrategy has purchased 1,070 more bitcoin for $100 million, advancing an ambitious plan to raise $2 billion this quarter as part of its three-year strategy to acquire $42 billion of BTC.

‚ö° Solana developers have proposed a lattice-based hashing system to address the ‚Äústate growth problem,‚Äù aiming to scale the network to billions of accounts while maintaining high security and efficiency.

üèõÔ∏è Stablecoin advocate and U.S. Federal Reserve board member Michael Barr yesterday announced his resignation as the Fed‚Äôs reserve vice chair for supervision, citing concerns over potential clashes with the incoming administration of Donald Trump.

‚ö°üìà Solana staking network Solayer has unveiled InfiniSVM, a hardware-accelerated blockchain solution claiming one millisecond transaction confirmation times.

Today in Crypto Adoption...

üá™üá∫ Four companies, including crypto trading platform MoonPay and digital asset management firm BitStaete, have obtained EU MiCA licenses in the Netherlands, giving them regulatory approval to operate across all 27 European Union countries.

üáÆüá™ HashKey Group has secured virtual asset service provider approval in Ireland, enabling it to offer crypto trading and custody services as part of its global expansion strategy in key markets including Hong Kong and Singapore.

‚úÖ Crypto trading firm GSR has obtained Financial Conduct Authority approval to operate as a registered crypto asset business in the UK.

The $$$ Corner‚Ä¶

üéÆ Gaming layer 2 ZKcandy, powered by ZKsync, has raised $4 million in private funding to develop a Telegram-based ethereum virtual machine gaming ecosystem and artificial intelligence gaming agents, targeting a mainnet launch later this year.

üíº Crypto exchange Backpack Exchange acquired FTX EU for $32.7 million, positioning itself as the only regulated perpetual futures provider in Europe, with plans to expand its crypto derivatives offerings under the MiCA framework early this year.

Coinbase Teases Onchain Stock üò±
Plus, üöÄ Ethena rises on expansion plans, üè¶ MARA lends BTC reserves, ‚ùå Phantom denies token rumors, and more!
JUAN ARANOVICH
JAN 06, 2025
1
Share

Greetings! I‚Äôm Juan Aranovich, managing editor of Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üåü Coinbase explores tokenized stock on L2

üéÆ Grants for gaming buoyed by ARB

üöÄ ENA jumps after roadmap reveal

‚öñÔ∏è Crypto rules on U.S. lawmakers agenda

üìâ Major unlocks upcoming

üè¶ MARA taps bitcoin borrowers

‚ùå Phantom says no token coming

Share your vision with Stellar‚Äôs Build Better initiative. Help shape blockchain‚Äôs future and enter to win from a $30,000 prize pool.

Learn More Here

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Sage D. Young, Veronica Irwin and Tikta
Base Creators Looking at Putting COIN on L2

A tokenized version of Coinbase‚Äôs stock, which trades on the Nasdaq under the ticker COIN, could soon be available on the crypto exchange‚Äôs layer 2 network, Base.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs something we are looking into in the new year,‚Äù Jesse Pollak, head of Base and Coinbase Wallet, posted on X.

Pollak went on to clarify that ‚Äúthere are no concrete plans‚Äù as of now, and that the team was still in an exploratory phase of understanding how to bring COIN onchain in a way that would be compliant with U.S. regulations.

Non-U.S. citizens can already access tokenized real-world assets such as COIN on platforms such as Backed Finance.

Arbitrum‚Äôs $190M Gaming Catalyst Program Ready to Go

More than six months after the Arbitrum DAO approved the use of 225 million ARB tokens worth roughly $190 million to grow the network‚Äôs gaming ecosystem, its Gaming Catalyst Program is ready to start investing and providing grants to gaming projects.

The program‚Äôs contributors have not only created an initial entity structure to support investment mandates, but have also formed a corresponding structure enabling program staffing and compensation frameworks, according to the program‚Äôs first transparency report.

Ethena‚Äôs Token Jumps on Plans for TradFi, Telegram Expansion

Ethena, a fast-growing crypto project with a synthetic dollar token positioned as an alternative to stablecoins such as Tether‚Äôs USDT, saw its token jump on Friday after founder Guy Young detailed plans for a new offering geared toward traditional financial institutions.

There‚Äôs also a planned integration with messaging platform Telegram and an expected buildout of a dedicated Ethena network.

After Young shared a long-form blog post detailing the protocol‚Äôs 2025 roadmap, governance token ENA‚Äôs price jumped 16% to $1.23, giving the cryptocurrency a market cap of $3.6 billion, according to CoinGecko.

Crypto Might Get Reality Check from Friendly U.S. Congress

Following the opening of the 119th U.S. Congressional session last week, politicians have promised clarity on regulatory requirements for stablecoins, a framework for deciding whether crypto firms are mostly overseen by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission or the Securities and Exchange Commission, and even the establishment of a bitcoin national reserve.

Spiking cryptocurrency prices indicate that investors expect regulatory clarity faster than the government may be able to provide it. Policy advocates are thinking in terms of what can be passed in the next two years. While Congress may lean pro-crypto, getting a bill to the president‚Äôs desk will take time.

‚ÄúWe should contextualize ‚Äòquickly,‚Äô‚Äù said Marta Belcher, president and chair of the Filecoin Foundation, which facilitates governance for the eponymous decentralized storage network. ‚ÄúQuickly is quickly for Congress, which is not quickly for what anyone in the industry would think of.‚Äù

$759M of Token Unlocks Coming Up

Around $759 million of token unlocks are set to hit the market over the next seven days, according to data from tokenomics platform Tokenomist.

The biggest unlocks to come will be from Aptos‚Äôs native token, APT, valued at $114 million, and Movement‚Äôs token, MOVE, valued at $54 million.

In January, the crypto market will see around $7.1 billion of token unlocks.

A token unlock is the process of releasing previously locked tokens into circulation, which typically results in a drop in token price. The process is usually governed by smart contracts that automatically release tokens based on predetermined conditions or timeframes.

They can take the form of ‚Äúcliff unlocks‚Äù involving large, one-time releases of tokens, or ‚Äúlinear unlocks,‚Äù gradual, continuous distributions of tokens over time.

Photo by Radu Prodan on Unsplash
Bitcoin Miner MARA Lends 16% of BTC Reserves

Major Bitcoin mining firm MARA said in a recent production update that it had loaned 7,377 BTC from its reserves to third parties as of Dec. 31, 2024.

The amount MARA has lent amounts to roughly 16% of its total bitcoin reserves and was worth around $730 million at the time of writing. MARA‚Äôs total BTC holdings are valued at $4.2 billion.

MARA‚Äôs head of investor relations, Robert Samuels, shed more light on the firm‚Äôs BTC lending program, saying it had been active throughout 2024 and had generated a ‚Äúmodest single-digit yield.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe long-term objective is to generate sufficient yield to offset operating expenses, " Samuels said.

Photo by Traxer on Unsplash
Crypto Wallet Phantom Has ‚ÄòNo Plans‚Äô to Launch Token

The team behind popular non-custodial crypto wallet Phantom poured cold water on users‚Äô hopes for an airdrop tied to its upcoming social discovery feature.

After Phantom announced the feature, which allows users to customize profiles, follow friends, and seamlessly transfer crypto, on Dec. 19, some members of the community speculated that gaining followers could be a way of becoming eligible for token rewards.

‚ÄúWe've seen some speculation about an airdrop tied to this feature, so to clarify: we do not have any plans to launch a token,‚Äù the Phantom team said on X.

‚ÄúBut we're incredibly excited about social discovery on Phantom and are actively working on ways to make it something everyone loves.‚Äù

Deposit Now!

Daily Bits‚Ä¶ ‚úçÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è‚úç

üìÑ Coinbase's chief legal officer has revealed unredacted Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation "pause letters," accusing the agency of regulatory overreach by urging banks to halt crypto-related services, sparking calls for Congressional hearings.

üêõ Virtuals Protocol addressed a critical vulnerability flagged by a security researcher, quickly patching the problem and announcing plans for a bug bounty program to enhance ecosystem security.

‚ö†Ô∏è Aave's proposal to peg Ethena's USDe to USDT raised concerns over systemic risks and conflicts of interest, as critics questioned the logic of equating assets with starkly different backing mechanisms.

üìà DeFi protocols such as MakerDAO and Aave enjoyed a revenue rush in 2024, with both platforms nearing or surpassing 2021 highs, signaling a robust recovery for the sector.

üìä Japanese Bitcoin treasury firm Metaplanet aims to expand its bitcoin holdings to 10,000 BTC this year, a significant increase from its current 1,761 BTC, using strategic capital market tools to strengthen its presence in the Bitcoin ecosystem.

Today in Crypto Adoption...

üåç Coinbase has expanded its European presence by acquiring mobile brokerage BUX's Cyprus unit, securing a Cyprus Investment Firm license to align with MiCA regulations and offer contracts for differences across the European Economic Area.

The $$$ Corner‚Ä¶

üîí Bitcoin wallet developer JAN3 raised $5 million in seed funding to enhance its AQUA wallet, allocating $1 million to build a bitcoin treasury as it focuses on combining bitcoin saving with USDT spending functionality.

title: What‚Äôs Fast for Congress Isn‚Äôt Fast for Crypto üê¢
content:
Discover more from Unchained
Your no-hype resource for all things crypto
Over 17,000 subscribers
By subscribing, I agree to Substack's Terms of Use, and acknowledge its Information Collection Notice and Privacy Policy.
Subscribe
Continue reading
Sign in
TRADGOV (PREVIOUSLY UNREGULATED)
What‚Äôs Fast for Congress Isn‚Äôt Fast for Crypto üê¢
What to expect from the 119th Congress.
VERONICA IRWIN
JAN 03, 2025
2
Share

Hey! I‚Äôm Veronica Irwin, Unchained‚Äôs regulatory reporter.

What are your New Year‚Äôs resolutions? My list is several pages long (I always get too ambitious) and includes reading more, working out more, and journaling more.

One resolution in particular is something the whole crypto industry should probably work on ‚Äì being more patient. That‚Äôs because crypto legislation is probably going to take Congress a whole lot longer than much of the community expects.¬†

Crypto Might Get Reality Check from Friendly U.S. Congress
U.S. legislative leaders say crypto bills will be a major priority as the 119th Congress gets underway in Washington. (Kollen Post)

The 119th Congressional session begins today. Politicians have promised clarity on regulatory requirements for stablecoins, a framework for deciding whether crypto firms are mostly overseen by the CFTC or SEC, even the establishment of a bitcoin national reserve.¬†

Spiking cryptocurrency prices indicate that investors expect regulatory clarity faster than the government may be able to provide it. Policy advocates are thinking in terms of what can be passed in the next two years; while Congress may lean pro-crypto, getting a bill to the president‚Äôs desk will take time.¬†

‚ÄúWe should contextualize ‚Äòquickly,‚Äô‚Äù explained Marta Belcher, president and chair of the Filecoin Foundation, which facilitates governance for the decentralized storage network Filecoin. ‚ÄúQuickly is quickly for Congress, which is not quickly for what anyone in the industry would think of.‚Äù¬†

Market Structure and Stablecoins¬†

Two bills ‚Äì on stablecoins and general market structure ‚Äì occupied most of the crypto-related attention during the last Congressional session. Rep. French Hill, who leads the House Financial Services Committee, has promised to pass both bills through committee in the first 100 legislative days. Senate Banking Committee Chair Tim Scott, House Agriculture Committee Chair Glenn ‚ÄúGT‚Äù Thompson, and Senate Agriculture Chair John Boozman also have expressed support for getting bills passed. Legislation would likely originate in these committees before going to floor votes. The House committees took the lead drafting legislation last session, and are expected to do so again.¬†

Read More: Crypto-Savvy Rep. French Hill Will Chair House Financial Services Committee

Most policy advocates expect stablecoin legislation to come first, given that Republicans and Democrats on the House Financial Services Committee nearly reached a compromise last year. The biggest contention is whether stablecoins have to be one-to-one backed by U.S. dollars, Belcher said, arguing that this requirement would be ‚Äúabove and beyond‚Äù what is asked of other sectors.¬†

Market structure legislation, meanwhile, is significantly more complex. While the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act (FIT21), which would likely be used as a starting draft for a bill introduced this year, Republicans seem eager to use their newfound majority in the Senate as a reason to pass a bill that is more ambitious. And while FIT21 received bipartisan support in the House and Senate, three sources told Unchained last year that key Democrats like Senate minority leader (majority leader at the time) Chuck Schumer only voted ‚Äúyes‚Äù on FIT21 because they knew president Biden would veto it ‚Äî essentially, wanting to appear ‚Äúpro crypto‚Äù without actually making the bill law. This raises questions as to whether Democrats would show more resistance to a bill under a Trump presidency.¬†

Bitcoin Reserve

Legal experts are divided on whether Trump needs the support of Congress for the Treasury to hold Bitcoin as a national reserve currency.¬†

The odds that Trump signs an executive order to accrue additional Bitcoin or convert existing Bitcoin holdings into Treasury reserves are currently less than 50%, according to Dennis Porter, who founded the Satoshi Action Fund, which advocates for pro-Bitcoin policy at the state and federal level. Things could change by inauguration day ‚Äì scheduled for Jan. 20 ‚Äì if a state approves a reserve before then, Porter said.¬†

Read More: Trump Taps Hedge Fund Manager Scott Bessent to Be Treasury Secretary

Optimism that a bitcoin national reserve bill will get passed and approved by Congress, however, is tepid at best. Trump‚Äôs own speech at the Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville indicated that his goal was to have the government hold bitcoin it already has in its possession, not buy more. Last year, Wyoming Senator Cynthia Lummis‚Äô Bitcoin Reserve Legislation, which called for the Treasury to buy 200,000 bitcoins per year for the next five years, failed to gain traction.¬†

Castle Island Ventures General Partner Nic Carter told Bloomberg last month that he did not think enough members of Congress were on board for such a bill to get passed. Digital Chamber founder and CEO Perianne Boring told Reuters that she thought such a bill could pass, albeit not within the first 100 days. All in all, it seems that if national reserve legislation is approved by Congress, it won‚Äôt be anytime soon.¬†

The Political Calculus

With each of these bills, there‚Äôs political pressure on members of Congress to get something done before the midterm elections in 2026, according to Dave Grimaldi, executive vice president of government relations at Blockchain Association.¬†

The crypto industry‚Äôs donations to political campaigns had an outsized impact on electoral outcomes in November, and the industry‚Äôs largest Political Action Committee, Fairshake, has already raised millions for the midterms. Nobody who will be running for a competitive seat can afford to appear anti-crypto.¬†

‚ÄúThe New Republican majority in the Senate and returning Republican majority in the House want to work with Democrats to make this an easy and quick process,‚Äù Grimaldi explained.¬†

Before the midterms, however, members of Congress don‚Äôt face any hard deadlines. It‚Äôs also safe to say that the Senate will be busy debating confirmations for controversial presidential political appointees over the first couple of months. Congress as a whole will be busy with Trump campaign priorities like border control and tax policy.¬†

Read More: Who Will Be Trump‚Äôs CFTC Chair? There‚Äôs a New Top Contender for the Role

As CoinDesk‚Äôs Jesse Hamilton pointed out in the State of Crypto newsletter, it could take over a year for some of the changes articulated in crypto legislation to become reality.¬†

If the CFTC is given authority to oversee crypto in market structure legislation, for example, it could take months to design and implement a new set of rules, even if someone who has experience in the agency, like former commissioner Brian Quintenz or current commissioner Summer Mersinger, is chosen as chair. Blockchain Association CEO Kristin Smith told Unchained last month that the rulemaking process takes about 18 months.¬†

All of this means that when it comes to laws covering the crypto industry, change could take more than a year, if not several years, to become reality. And though that‚Äôs fast for government, it‚Äôs likely a pace the crypto markets will need some adjusting to.¬†

Related stories from Unchained:

Trump Announces Team Working With AI & Crypto Czar

Who Will Be Trump‚Äôs CFTC Chair? There‚Äôs a New Top Contender for the Role

Ohio Republican Senator Bernie Moreno to Serve on Influential Senate Banking Committee

title: What Will AI Agents Do in Crypto?
content:
Discover more from Unchained
Your no-hype resource for all things crypto
Over 17,000 subscribers
By subscribing, I agree to Substack's Terms of Use, and acknowledge its Information Collection Notice and Privacy Policy.
Subscribe

UNCHAINED WEEKLY
What Will AI Agents Do in Crypto?
The Friday episode features Shaw Walters, founder of Eliza Labs, on the rise of AI agents. Plus, the weekly news recap.
JUAN ARANOVICH
JAN 03, 2025
3
Share

In this week‚Äôs edition:

üìÜ IRS delays crypto tax reporting rules to 2026.

üö® Siqi Chen faces backlash for alleged ZERO token rug pull.

‚úàÔ∏è Do Kwon extradited to the U.S. to face fraud charges.

üìà Ethereum ETFs close 2024 with $2.7 billion in inflows.

‚öñÔ∏è Celsius appeals $444M claim rejection against FTX.

üí∏ USD0 stablecoin briefly depegs after whale sell-off.

üîó HYPE token staking launches with $9.4 billion staked.

üí∞ Tether adds $700M in Bitcoin to strategic reserves.

With AI Agents Now Trading Crypto, What Does Their Future Look Like?

The accidental success of ai16z has catapulted AI agents and their transformational promise into the spotlight. Shaw Walters, founder of Eliza Labs, shares his bold vision for how they can reshape finance, social media, and society at large.

In this episode, Shaw Walters, founder of Eliza Labs, takes us through his journey of launching ai16z, a decentralized AI-driven investment DAO, and the explosive growth of the Eliza open-source framework.

Shaw explains how AI agents are evolving beyond ‚Äúreply bots‚Äù to serve as powerful tools for financial autonomy, community investment, and user empowerment. He shares the challenges of building trust between humans and AI, the possibilities of agents trading across multiple blockchains, and his vision of a world where financial freedom drives human progress.

Listen to the episode on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Pods, Fountain, Podcast Addict, Pocket Casts, Amazon Music, or on your favorite podcast platform.

Weekly News Recap
IRS Postpones Crypto Cost-Basis Reporting Rules to 2026

The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) announced a one-year delay in implementing new cryptocurrency tax reporting rules, pushing the effective date to January 1, 2026. The decision gives brokers more time to adapt their systems to the updated requirements.

The rules, introduced in July 2024, mandate taxpayers to specify which cryptocurrency units they are selling. If no method is identified, the default First In, First Out (FIFO) method will apply, which prioritizes selling the earliest acquired assets. Tax experts, such as Shehan Chandrasekera from CoinTracker, warn this could unintentionally increase capital gains for investors, as older assets often have a lower cost basis.

‚ÄúThis delay avoids a scenario that could have been disastrous in the current bull market environment,‚Äù Chandrasekera explained on X.

Photo by Sean Lee on Unsplash
Siqi Chen Faces Backlash Over Alleged Rug Pull With ‚ÄòZero‚Äô Token

Siqi Chen, CEO of finance platform Runway and creator of the MIRA token, has come under fire for his actions involving a test token called ZERO. The controversy follows the launch of the MIRA token on Christmas day, created to support pediatric brain tumor research after Chen‚Äôs four-year-old daughter, Mira, was diagnosed with a rare brain tumor. MIRA gained widespread attention and significant backing from the crypto community, with Chen‚Äôs holdings in the token reportedly reaching $14 million.

Amid the MIRA initiative, Chen launched ZERO on the Solana-based platform Pump.fun, describing it as a test token with the label: ‚ÄúThis coin will go to zero‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt buy it.‚Äù Despite the warning, investor interest quickly drove ZERO‚Äôs market cap to $6 million. Chen admitted to selling 40% of the supply, earning 444 SOL (approximately $90,000), which he claims to have used to buy back tokens before burning them.

‚ÄúI take responsibility and [I] am committing to making every affected wallet whole out of my own personal funds,‚Äù Chen wrote on X. Critics, however, are skeptical, pointing to Chen‚Äôs repeated incidents involving similar tokens and questioning his claims of inexperience. The controversy has cast a shadow over his efforts with MIRA, despite its original philanthropic mission.

Terraform Labs Co-Founder Do Kwon Extradited to the U.S.

Montenegro has extradited Terraform Labs co-founder Do Kwon to the U.S., following months of legal proceedings and coordination with Interpol. Montenegro‚Äôs Ministry of Justice finalized the decision after rejecting Kwon‚Äôs appeal against extradition, citing the severity of his alleged crimes and the order of competing requests from South Korea and the U.S.

Kwon, who was arrested in Montenegro in March 2023 for traveling with forged documents, now faces criminal charges in the U.S., including conspiracy to commit fraud, money laundering, and electronic fraud. These charges stem from his involvement in the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin and Luna cryptocurrency, which caused billions in investor losses.

The extradition decision underscores the international collaboration involved in Kwon‚Äôs case, with Montenegro‚Äôs Special Police Unit and Interpol playing key roles in transferring him to U.S. custody. Kwon‚Äôs trial in the U.S. is expected to focus on the financial crimes linked to Terraform Labs.

Photo by Harry Shelton on Unsplash
Ethereum ETFs Close Out 2024 With $2.7 Billion Inflows

Ethereum ETFs ended 2024 with a remarkable $2.7 billion in net inflows, according to Farside Investors. The Fidelity Ethereum Fund led the market with $31.8 million in inflows on the final trading day, while the Grayscale Ethereum Mini Trust saw $9.8 million in additional investments.

Meanwhile, Ethereum has achieved a significant milestone in holder behavior. Onchain analytics firm IntoTheBlock reported that 75% of ether holders are now long-term investors, compared to bitcoin‚Äôs 62%. This marks a notable shift, as bitcoin‚Äôs long-term holder percentage declined over the year, likely influenced by record profit-taking volumes reaching $2.1 billion daily.

Photo by Traxer on Unsplash
Celsius Appeals Rejection of $444 Million Claim Against FTX

Celsius Network, the bankrupt crypto lender, has filed an appeal challenging a court decision that disallowed its $444 million claim against bankrupt crypto exchange FTX. The appeal follows Judge John Dorsey‚Äôs December ruling, which dismissed Celsius‚Äô amended claims for failing to meet procedural requirements.

Initially, Celsius sought $2 billion in damages, alleging that disparaging statements from FTX executives undermined confidence in its platform, hastening its collapse. The claim was later amended to focus on preferential transfers, demanding $444 million in repayments for funds allegedly given undue priority.

Photo by Mariia Shalabaieva on Unsplash
Whale Activity Briefly Depegs USD0 Stablecoin

On Wednesday, the decentralized stablecoin Usual USD, also known as USD0, experienced a temporary depegging, trading at $0.99 following a substantial sell-off by a single whale in the secondary market. Despite the disruption, USD0 swiftly regained its $1 peg within hours.

‚ÄúThis was our first major stress test of the USD0 peg, with more redemptions than the entire [total value locked] of GHO in a few hours ‚Äî yet it was business as usual,‚Äù the protocol‚Äôs team shared on X.

USD0 is fully backed by short-term, liquid, risk-free assets such as U.S. Treasury Bills and repurchase agreements to ensure robust collateralization.

HYPE Token Staking Launches on HyperLiquid Mainnet

The Hyper Foundation has officially launched staking for its native token, HYPE, on the HyperLiquid decentralized exchange mainnet. Token holders can now delegate their HYPE to validators in exchange for staking rewards, a system designed to secure the network while rewarding community participation.

At launch, 357.6 million HYPE tokens, valued at approximately $9.4 billion, were staked, representing significant early adoption. The Hyper Foundation controlled 99.9% of the staked tokens through its validators, but this stake has since decreased to 88.8%, reflecting increased community participation.

‚ÄúStaking is an important milestone for HyperLiquid because it allows the diverse community of HYPE stakers to collectively secure the network,‚Äù the foundation wrote on X. Plans for a delegation program to reward high-performing validators are underway, aiming to bolster network decentralization and security.

Tether Adds $700 Million in Bitcoin to Strategic Reserve

Tether, the issuer of the USDT stablecoin, has transferred 7,629 bitcoin (worth approximately $700 million) to its strategic reserve, according to onchain data from Arkham Intelligence. The transfer, originating from Bitfinex's hot wallet, marks Tether's largest bitcoin allocation since March 2024.

This move brings Tether‚Äôs total bitcoin holdings to over 83,000 BTC, valued at more than $7.6 billion. Since May 2023, the company has allocated up to 15% of its net profits to bitcoin as part of its diversification strategy.

Tether‚Äôs reserves primarily comprise U.S. Treasury bonds and cash equivalents, but the company has been expanding its investments into bitcoin, AI, and decentralized communications, reflecting its broader ambitions in emerging sectors.

Photo by Traxer on Unsplash
üòÇ FUN BITS: Swiss Bitcoiners Try to Make Their Central Bank a Bitcoin Whale

Move over gold bars ‚Äî Swiss Bitcoin enthusiasts have a plan to make their central bank go full crypto. In a move as bold as it is bananas, they‚Äôre pushing to rewrite Switzerland‚Äôs constitution to force the Swiss National Bank (SNB) to add Bitcoin to its reserves.

‚ÄúGold‚Äôs in the constitution, and Bitcoin is the best-performing asset of the last decade,‚Äù argued Yves Benna√Øm, the mastermind behind this plot and founder of Bitcoin non-profit 2B4CH.

Because why stop at world-class watches when you can have world-class hodling?

The group has 18 months to gather 100,000 signatures to kick-start the process. If they succeed, Switzerland might someday vote on whether their central bankers should start stacking sats.

Of course, the SNB has been about as warm to Bitcoin as an Alpine glacier, citing the network's energy use and the volatility of its native token. But hey, if a constitutional change doesn‚Äôt convince them, maybe a ‚Äúlaser eyes‚Äù filter on their official portrait will!

Watch the Recap!

To stay updated with everything that‚Äôs going on in crypto, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.

JUAN ARANOVICH

1
Share

Happy Friday! I‚Äôm Juan Aranovich, managing editor of Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üî• Coinbase‚Äôs L2 notches 3M addresses

üöÄ Meme-driven tokens push to record highs

üí∏ BlackRock‚Äôs Bitcoin ETF springs a leak

ü•∫ Do Kwon: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm innocent‚Äù

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Sage D. Young and Tikta
As Solana Rivalry Heats Up, Coinbase‚Äôs L2 Sets New Records for Addresses, Transactions

Base has kicked off the new year achieving new milestones in onchain activity, strengthening its competitive position vis-√†-vis Solana.

The number of daily active addresses on Base climbed from under 70,000 in January last year to a new all-time high of three million on Wednesday, while the network‚Äôs daily transactions reached 13.4 million, representing an increase of around 3,521% from fewer than 375,000 transactions a year earlier, according to data from blockchain analytics firm Artemis.

AI Meme Tokens Punch up in Potential 2025 Trend

Crypto markets are already dashing doubts that the intersection of blockchain and artificial intelligence technologies could end up being one of 2025‚Äôs most explosive investment narratives.

Tokens associated with AI tools and related memes are leading gains so far in the new year, advancing to record prices and market capitalizations.

BlackRock‚Äôs Bitcoin ETF Sees Record $333M Outflow

BlackRock‚Äôs U.S. spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund has seen its biggest-ever single-day exodus of funds.

Investors pulled $332.6 million from the iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) on Jan. 2, according to data from investment management boutique Farside Investors.

IBIT also saw more moderate outflows of $36.5 million and $23.5 million on 2024‚Äôs last two trading days.

The fund was one of the best performers among all spot ETF assets in the U.S. in 2024, ranking third in net inflows and seeing only 11 days of outflows during the year.

Photo by Traxer on Unsplash
Do Kwon Pleads Not Guilty to U.S. Criminal Charges

Terraform Labs co-founder Do Kwon has pleaded not guilty to criminal charges in the U.S., according to a report by Reuters.

Kwon appeared before U.S. Magistrate Judge Robert Lehrburger in a Manhattan courtroom on Thursday, shortly after his extradition from Montenegro earlier this week. Kwon reportedly appeared to be in ‚Äúgood spirits.‚Äù

Federal prosecutors also unsealed a nine-count indictment that charges Kwon with securities fraud, wire fraud, commodities fraud, and money laundering conspiracy related to the $40 billion in estimated losses from Terra‚Äôs collapse in 2022.

Kwon‚Äôs next court appearance is scheduled for Jan. 8.

Tether‚Äôs Market Cap Sinks $2B as MiCA Takes Effect

USDT‚Äôs market cap has dropped $2.1 billion in the last week, falling from $139.2 billion to $137.1 billion as the European Union's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulatory framework came into force.

That slump was USDT‚Äôs biggest drop since the collapse of FTX in 2022.

MiCA took effect on Dec. 30, ushering in a new era of crypto oversight in Europe that requires stablecoin issuers to obtain an e-money license and maintain up to two-thirds of reserves in independent banks. That makes Tether‚Äôs stablecoin, USDT, effectively illegal within the EU.

Separately, Tether and Bitfinex General Counsel Stuart Hoegner has retired, leaving Michael Hilliard, with whom Hoegner co-led Tether‚Äôs legal work, to take his place.

Photo by DrawKit Illustrations on Unsplash
Lens to Offer ICOs and ‚ÄòNew Flavour‚Äô of ERC-20s

Stani Kulechov, the founder of DeFi lender Aave and decentralized social media network Lens, has shared plans to release a new set of contracts on Lens.

The new features include initial coin offerings, a new ‚Äúflavour‚Äù of ERC-20 tokens, bonding curves, ERC-721 contracts and point systems. Kulechov said that all of the new smart contracts would be open source.

Lens was developed by the team behind Aave with the goal of being an alternative to traditional centralized social networks such as X and Instagram. It closed a $31 millionstrategic round led by venture capital fund Lightspeed Faction last month.

Daily Bits‚Ä¶ ‚úçÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è‚úç

üè¶ Non-custodial lending platform Frax Finance approved BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL token as the backing for its frxUSD stablecoin, integrating treasury management and blockchain transparency to enhance financial stability.

üó£Ô∏è Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin criticized Elon Musk‚Äôs ban-heavy approach and inflammatory language on X, warning it threatens free speech and risks fostering an uncivil and divided discourse.

üîí Tron‚Äôs T3 Financial Crime Fighting Unit, with Tether and TRM Labs, froze $100 million in illicit USDT, targeting crimes such as money laundering, scams, and hacks across five continents.

üåê Solana‚Äôs restaking protocol, Solayer, introduced its LAYER governance token alongside a new foundation, aiming to expand ecosystem growth and support advanced scaling solutions.

üéÅ Solana‚Äôs Drift Protocol plans a second airdrop in May, leveraging its loyalty program to reward users after achieving $55 billion in trading volume and onboarding more than 200,000 traders.

Today in Crypto Adoption...

üì± Crypto exchange KuCoin launched a point-of-sale system enabling merchants to accept 54 cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin and USDT, via QR codes, bridging crypto with traditional payments.

What Do You Meme?

ETH is down 0.2%, trading at $3,445

title: üí∞ 39 Lessons for Your Bags
content:
Discover more from Unchained
Your no-hype resource for all things crypto
Over 17,000 subscribers
By subscribing, I agree to Substack's Terms of Use, and acknowledge its Information Collection Notice and Privacy Policy.
Subscribe
Continue reading
Sign in
üí∞ 39 Lessons for Your Bags
Plus, üìà They weren‚Äôt a flop after all, üìâ A brief but scary depeg, üêß Pump.fun takes profits, and more!
JUAN ARANOVICH
JAN 02, 2025
1
Share

I‚Äôm Juan Aranovich, managing editor of Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üí∞ Use it, don‚Äôt lose it

üìà Ether ETFs close 2024 with hefty inflows

üìâ Whale trade causes USD0 wobble

üêß Pump.fun moves sacks of SOL

ü•º DeSci takes off

Earn 20%+ APR on ETH with High Growth Vault by Kelp

High Gain is your tokenized solution for generating the highest rewards on ETH in 1 click‚Äì while keeping you liquid with hgETH.

Deposit Now!

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Sage D. Young and Tikta
39 Ways to Lose Money in Crypto: How to Keep Your Money Safe

Folks in the crypto ecosystem have witnessed an extraordinary level of wealth creation since Satoshi Nakamoto first introduced Bitcoin in 2009.

Just this year, the overall market capitalization of digital assets has soared to $3.5 trillion, pretty much doubling from under $1.8 trillion at the start of the year. On the flip side, there‚Äôs no shortage of ways to lose money in crypto.

In 2024, crypto users suffered losses of around $1.5 billion, according to a report published by blockchain security firm Immunefi.

Instead of providing examples of how people have pocketed money, Imunefi‚Äôs report goes straight for the safety-first approach ‚Äî or, rather the learn-from-the-mistakes-of-others strategy ‚Äî highlighting the countless ways in which people have seen funds disappear, never to return. Striving to be comprehensive, we have enumerated 39. There are probably way more.

Ethereum ETFs End 2024 With $2.7B in Net Inflows

U.S. spot ether exchange-traded funds closed out the year with $2.7 billion of net inflows, according to data from investment management boutique Farside Investors.

The Fidelity Ethereum Fund recorded an impressive $31.8 million in net inflows on the last day of the trading year. The Grayscale Ethereum Mini Trust saw a modest $9.8 million worth of inflows on the day.

Some industry watchers believe that the recent inflows into Ethereum ETFs ‚Äî particularly in comparison to Bitcoin ETFs ‚Äî may indicate a shift in investor sentiment and could potentially set the stage for increased competition between the two cryptocurrencies this year.

Photo by Kanchanara on Unsplash
USD0 Briefly Depegs After Single Whale‚Äôs Trade

The Usual protocol saw a major sell-off of its decentralized stablecoin, USD0, triggered by a large whale transaction in the secondary market on Jan. 1.

The sell-off caused USD0 to trade briefly at $0.99, but it was able to fully recapitalise and regain its U.S. dollar peg within a few hours.

‚ÄúOverall, this was our first major stress test of the USD0 peg, with more redemptions than the entire [total value locked] of GHO in a few hours ‚Äî yet it was business as Usual,‚Äù the protocol‚Äôs team said in a post on X.

USD0 is fully collateralized by short-term, liquid, risk-free assets ‚Äî mainly U.S. Treasury Bills and repurchase agreements. It is part of a broader ecosystem that includes USD0++, a liquid staking token, and $USUAL, the protocol's governance token.

Pump.fun Moves Over $55M SOL to Kraken

Solana-based memecoin marketplace Pump.fun may be cashing out a significant amount of SOL.

The Pump.fun fee account moved $22.88 million of SOL to crypto exchange Kraken on Wednesday, according to data from blockchain analysis platform Arkham.

The fee account then moved another $32.7 million of SOL to Kraken through a new wallet address.

Pump.fun‚Äôs fee account currently holds around $23.3 million of SOL and $13.1 million of liquid staking token JitoSOL.

DeSci Sees 2,640% Mindshare Uptick in 2024

Narratives change quickly in the crypto space, but none grew as fast in 2024 as decentralized science, or DeSci, protocols.

DeSci has seen a 2,640% increase in mindshare since January 2024, according to data shared by Sandra Leow, a research partner at Web3 information platform Kaito.

The second-biggest increase was observed in trusted execution environments, which saw a 192% uptick over the year.

Artificial intelligence, chain abstraction, stablecoins, and Solana virtual machines are also seeing increased interest, but the narrative around layer 2 networks, liquid restaking tokens, and the BRC-20 token standard has less buzz than it used to.

2024 Was Full of Fascinating Crypto News. Here Are Its Top Moments

From the groundbreaking success of the ETFs to Solana‚Äôs dominance and the Trump effect on Bitcoin, we look back at the stories and voices that defined 2024.

2024 was nothing short of transformative for the crypto world. From bitcoin‚Äôs relentless climb amidst macroeconomic shifts to Solana‚Äôs continued rise amidst meme coin mania, this year saw narratives unfold that no one could have predicted.

In this special episode that has become a tradition at Unchained, Laura revisits the biggest moments of the year, featuring insightful clips from the standout guests who joined Unchained and Bits + Bips in 2024.

Whether it was further institutional adoption, debates over decentralization, the victory over Gary Genser‚Äôs regulation by enforcement strategy, or the taking off of AI agents, this year marked a turning point for crypto. Tune in for a reflective journey through the year that was‚Äîand a glimpse of what lies ahead in 2025.

Plus, ü™ô HYPE staking debuts, üö® the Bandit is back, üè¶ Tether bets on BTC, and more!
TIKTA
DEC 31, 2024
2
Share

Happy 31st! I‚Äôm Tikta, a reporter at Unchained. Bring on the new year!

In today‚Äôs edition:

ü§® MIRA dad faces doubts

üí∞ HYPE rolls out staking

üí∏ High-profile hacker returns to haunt us

‚õΩ Tether‚Äôs bitcoin top-up

Earn 20%+ APR on ETH with High Growth Vault by Kelp

High Gain is your tokenized solution for generating the highest rewards on ETH in 1 click‚Äì while keeping you liquid with hgETH.

Deposit Now!

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
MIRA‚Äôs Siqi Chen Apologizes for ‚ÄòPanic Selling‚Äô Own Token

Tech CEO Siqi Chen helped to raise millions of dollars on Christmas Day for his four-year-old daughter, Mira, whose diagnosis with a rare type of brain tumor inspired the creation of an eponymous Solana memecoin. Now, just a few days later, Chen has claimed that he inadvertently orchestrated a rug pull in a token he created named ZERO.

‚Äúi [sic] am so sorry i [sic] messed this up so badly on behalf of the $MIRA and Solana communities,‚Äù he wrote on X, vowing to make users whole with his personal funds. ‚Äúi [sic] am committed to making sure mine and $MIRA‚Äôs integrity and mission is upheld.‚Äù

Chen said he created ZERO as a test token on Pump.fun, marking it with the description ‚Äúthis is going to zero ‚Ä¶ do not buy it,‚Äù and later said he ‚Äúpanic‚Äù sold 40% of the supply, netting himself around 444 SOL ($83,470).

He then claimed to have spent the full amount buying back in, ‚Äúthen burned everything i [sic] have so the community knows at least that i [sic] have made zero in profits from this.‚Äù

Although he said he is ‚Äústill learning how this all works,‚Äù members of the crypto community aren‚Äôt necessarily convinced by his mea culpa. Two days ago, Chen claimed a ‚Äúmisclick‚Äù after buying 15% of Solana memecoin ChAIrity and exiting with a $60,000 profit after roughly 10 minutes.

Pseudonymous decentralized finance analyst The DeFi Edge noted that Chen‚Äôs claims to be a crypto newcomer don‚Äôt quite check out, based on tweets he posted years ago.

‚ÄúIt actually makes me sad to see this guy using his sick daughter for $ while larping as a crypto noob. He's been around for many years now participating in the scene,‚Äù another user wrote on X.

HYPE Token Staking Goes Live on Mainnet

The Hype Foundation, the entity behind decentralized exchange Hyperliquid, has announced that staking of HYPE tokens is now live on its mainnet.

Users can stake HYPE to validators in exchange for earnings token rewards. The Hype Foundation said it will support high-performing validators through a delegation program, with more information to be announced in due course.

Staking went live with 16 genesis validators, and Hype Foundation validators had a stake of 99.9% of the total HYPE staked at launch. The foundation‚Äôs stake has since dropped to 88.8%.

At the time of writing, a total of 357.6 million HYPE tokens had been staked, representing a value of $9.4 billion.

Blockchain Bandit Moves $172M ETH After 2 Years

Infamous online thief Blockchain Bandit has resurfaced after two years, moving 51,000 ETH worth around $172 million to a new multi-signature wallet.

The transfers were flagged by pseudonymous blockchain sleuth ZachXBT, who noted in a Telegram post that the funds had been moved in batches of 5,000 ETH on Dec. 30 between 8:54 p.m. UTC and 9:18 p.m. UTC.

The return of Blockchain Bandit has raised fears that the consolidated ETH could be used to fund further exploits.

The hacker originally stole funds between 2015 and 2018 through a method known as "ethercombing," which involved using software to guess weak passwords and access private keys. Using that technique, the hacker successfully guessed 732 private keys and drained more than 10,000 cryptocurrency wallets.

Tether Shifts $776M Bitcoin to Reserve

Tether, the company behind the USDT stablecoin, has made a significant addition to its Bitcoin reserves.

Tether transferred 7,629 BTC, valued at approximately $705 million, from Bitfinex's hot wallet to its strategic Bitcoin reserve address on Dec. 30. Around two hours later, it transferred another 775 BTC to the reserve address.

The latest addition to Tether‚Äôs reserve, its largest in nine months, takes the stablecoin issuer‚Äôs total BTC holdings to 83,759 BTC.

In May 2023, Tether said it planned to allocate up to 15% of its net realised operating profits to bitcoin.

TIKTA
DEC 30, 2024
2
Share

Greetings! Almost there for 2024! I‚Äôm Tikta, a reporter at Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üîé DeFi disclosures loom

ü™ù Do Kwon gets reeled in

üè¶ ETH HODLers increase

Earn 20%+ APR on ETH with High Growth Vault by Kelp

High Gain is your tokenized solution for generating the highest rewards on ETH in 1 click‚Äì while keeping you liquid with hgETH.

Deposit Now!

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
IRS Finalizes Controversial DeFi Broker Rule

The U.S. Internal Revenue Service has finalized a tax rule that would require certain decentralized finance brokers to collect and report on user activity.

The new regulation, set to take effect in 2027, calls for front-end DeFi protocols to file Forms 1099, ‚ÄúDigital Asset Proceeds from Broker Transactions,‚Äù and report information such as transaction IDs and wallet addresses.

‚ÄúThis rule has been ready to go for a while now,‚Äù Consensys‚Äô legal counsel, Bill Hughes, said in a post on X. ‚ÄúThey dump it [on] the last Friday of 2024 in the middle of a holiday stretch on purpose, obviously. As if we wouldn‚Äôt notice or make an absolute ruckus over it.‚Äù

Crypto lobbying groups such as the Blockchain Association, the DeFi Education Fund and the Texas Blockchain Council have filed a joint lawsuit against the IRS and the Treasury Department‚Äôs ‚Äúmidnight rulemaking.‚Äù

Do Kwon U.S. Extradition Order Gets a Green Light

Montenegro‚Äôs minister of justice, Bojan Bo≈æoviƒá, has signed an order allowing the extradition of Terra co-founder Do Kwon to the U.S.

The decision comes after the Supreme Court of Montenegro previously ruled that Kwon should be extradited to the U.S. after much back and forth over whether he should be extradited to his native South Korea instead.

Assessment criteria included the severity of Kwon‚Äôs criminal offenses, where his crimes were committed, and the order in which the U.S. and South Korea had submitted extradition requests.

Industry watchers believe that Kwon will likely face a harsher sentence in the U.S. than in South Korea, based on the way the American justice system prosecutes financial crimes.

Photo by niu niu on Unsplash
Long-Term ETH Holders Overtook Bitcoiners in 2024

The proportion of long-term ether holders has increased to 75% over the past year, while the proportion of long-term bitcoin holders has dropped to 62%, according to data from onchain analytics firm IntoTheBlock.

Bitcoin‚Äôs stellar performance in 2024 and ether‚Äôs relatively lacklustre year may have something to do with holders‚Äô behaviour.

Earlier this month, blockchain data firm Glassnode noted that long-term bitcoin holders took profits of $2.1 billion daily, a new all-time high volume.

Ethereum holders, conversely, might be holding out for higher ETH prices before cashing out.

Squid Game Scam Tokens Reappear as New Series Airs

Fraudulent crypto tokens based on the ‚ÄúSquid Game‚Äù Netflix series have once again found their way into the crypto market as the show goes to air for a second season.

Blockchain security firm PeckShield warned users about one such token deployed on Base that plummeted in value.

Data and analysis platform DEX Screener show that there are still several more tokens with the same name trading on decentralized exchanges.

In 2021, a group of unknown developers created a token called SQUID, marketing it as a "play-to-earn" opportunity inspired by the show.

TIKTA
DEC 27, 2024
Share

Happy holiday Friday! I‚Äôm Tikta, a reporter at Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üè• Solana memecoin raises $18 million for cancer research

üè¶ Bitwise takes aim at Bitcoin ETF

üé≤ Another ETF, this time from a MAGA booster

üîì Hackers target Animoca founder‚Äôs X account

Earn 20%+ APR on ETH with High Growth Vault by Kelp

High Gain is your tokenized solution for generating the highest rewards on ETH in 1 click‚Äì while keeping you liquid with hgETH.

Deposit Now!

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
Solana Memecoin MIRA Raises Millions for Cancer Research

Solana degens and magic internet money have delivered a Christmas miracle.

MIRA, a memecoin launched on Dec. 25 to support Mira Chen, a four-year-old girl diagnosed with a rare type of brain tumor, amassed $80 million in market cap in just a few hours following its debut.

It was created on Pump.fun by an anonymous user after Mira‚Äôs father, Siqi Chen, shared her story on social media and asked users to donate to the Hankinson Lab, a neurosurgery research center at the University of Colorado.

That anonymous user later identified themselves as X user Waddles, and sent 50% of MIRA‚Äôs supply to Chen. At one point, the value of his holdings was worth more than $18 million. After garnering support from the crypto community in X polls, Siqi liquidated a small portion of his holdings.

In an update posted on X, he said he plans to donate 100% of all proceeds directly to fund rare disease research.

‚ÄúStarting in about 12 hours, I will be liquidating $1,000 worth of MIRA every 10 minutes, perpetually. No more and no less than that. If I change this schedule, I commit to announcing it 24 hours in advance,‚Äù Chen said.

‚ÄúIf you want to rug it to $0, go for it ‚Äî at the end of the day we set out to raise $200K and we will end up with at least $1M towards rare disease research.‚Äù

At the time of writing, MIRA had a market cap of around $23 million and 16,300 holders, according to data from decentralized exchange tracker GeckoTerminal.

Bitwise Applies to Launch Bitcoin ETF

Crypto index fund manager Bitwise has submitted an application to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for a new exchange-traded fund.

According to a Dec. 26 filing, its Bitcoin Standard Corporations ETF would provide exposure to shares of companies with at least $100 million in market cap that adopt the Bitcoin standard and hold at least 1,000 BTC among their financial assets.

Bitwise‚Äôs fund would assign a weight to those companies based on the market value of their Bitcoin treasuries rather than their individual market capitalizations. Firms with more BTC on their balance sheets would be assigned a greater weight.

More than 20 companies are expected to be eligible for inclusion in the proposed ETF.

Vivek Ramaswamy‚Äôs Strive Files for Bitcoin Bond ETF

Strive Asset Management, a self-styled ‚Äúanti-woke‚Äù and ‚Äúanti-ESG‚Äù investment firm founded by rightwing entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy, has filed an application to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to launch a Bitcoin bond ETF.

The proposed Strive Bitcoin Bond ETF would aim to provide exposure to Bitcoin bonds ‚Äî convertible securities issued by companies such as MicroStrategy that use the proceeds of their offerings to purchase Bitcoin.

The ETF would be actively managed, investing directly in those bonds and using financial products such as swaps and options.

The fund would target convertible bonds issued by companies that have invested significant portions of their capital in Bitcoin.

Animoca Brands Founder‚Äôs X Account Hacked to Promote Fake Token

Animoca Brands co-founder and Chair Yat Siu‚Äôs X account has been compromised in a cyberattack.

Hackers took control of his account to promote a fake token dubbed Animoca Brands (MOCA) on the Solana blockchain.

Animoca Brands responded quickly to the incident, confirming the hack and warning users that the company was not introducing an official token or NFT.

The hack is part of a broader phishing scam targeting crypto-related X accounts that has reportedly stolen around $500,000 in the past month.

The $$$ Corner‚Ä¶

Plus, üìâ Bitcoin ETFs lose steam, üí¥ Mt. Gox transfers mount up, üíé Top two DeFi players pull in $75B, üîÆ Solana‚Äôs future, and more!
TIKTA
DEC 26, 2024
Share

Happy holidays! I‚Äôm Tikta, a reporter at Unchained.

In today‚Äôs edition:

üö£ Hyperliquid says it‚Äôs watertight

ü´¥ Bitcoin ETF investors pull funds

üöõ Mt. Gox rides rally to move money

üí∞ Aave and Lido bank it

‚òÄÔ∏è Solana shines

Earn 20%+ APR on ETH with High Growth Vault by Kelp

High Gain is your tokenized solution for generating the highest rewards on ETH in 1 click‚Äì while keeping you liquid with hgETH.

Deposit Now!

What‚Äôs Poppin‚Äô?
By Tikta
Hyperliquid Labs Denies Reports of North Korean Exploit

Hyperliquid Labs, the company behind the eponymous decentralized exchange built on its own layer 1 blockchain, has come out swinging in response to speculation it has been targeted by North Korean hackers.

The firm has denied reports of an exploit of any kind, and specifically one by North Korean state-backed hackers.

‚ÄúAll user funds are accounted for,‚Äù a member of the Hyperliquid team said on Discord. ‚ÄúHyperliquid Labs takes [operational security] seriously. No vulnerabilities have been shared by any party.‚Äù

MetaMask developer Taylor Monahan was among those warning that the crypto trading platform faced an elevated risk of being targeted by North Korean hackers.

‚ÄúSomeone claiming to be a security party previously attempted to reach out to Labs,‚Äù the Hyperliquid team said. ‚ÄúTo be clear, there was never any allegation of any exploit on Hyperliquid.

‚ÄúThis party added a scam account to a group chat and later communicated with insults and profanity,‚Äù the team said. ‚ÄúGiven the level of professionalism displayed, Labs conferred instead with trusted parties and confirmed it is following best practices.‚Äù

Photo by Pankaj Patel on Unsplash
Bitcoin ETFs See $1.3B of Outflows in Four Days

U.S. spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds have clocked up their longest streak of outflows since the days leading up to the election of Donald Trump as America‚Äôs next president.

The 12 spot bitcoin ETFs listed in the U.S. recorded $1.3 billion of outflows over the four most recent trading days, according to data from investment management firm Farside Investors.

The outflows coincide with a downward turn for bitcoin, which lost support above the $100,000 mark last week.

After falling to a low of $92,400 on Dec. 20, bitcoin has since regained momentum and is currently trading at around $98,000.

Mt. Gox Transfers $364M to OTC Market Maker B2C2

Bankrupt Japanese crypto exchange Mt. Gox has been among those making the most of bitcoin‚Äôs rally past $100,000 in mid-December.

The exchange has been sending installments of 200 BTC to 300 BTC to over-the-counter market maker B2C2 Group every weekday since bitcoin breached the historic milestone on Dec. 5, onchain wallet tracker Lookonchain found.

In total, Mt. Gox has transferred a total of $364 million to B2C2 Group.

Wallets belonging to Mt. Gox identified by blockchain analytics platform Arkham indicate that the exchange still holds $3.5 billion worth of bitcoin.

Mt. Gox began repaying its creditors after a decade-long bankruptcy process earlier this year.

As of July, the exchange had paid back 41.5% of the 142,000 BTC that it is set to distribute to creditors.

Photo by Traxer on Unsplash

DeFi‚Äôs Top Two Protocols Exceed $75B in Net Deposits

Decentralized lending protocol Aave and staking protocol Lido surpassed the $75 billion net deposit mark for the first time this month, according to data from analytics platform Token Terminal.

Net deposits ‚Äî distinct from total value locked (TVL) ‚Äî are the total sum deposited into a DeFi protocol, excluding transaction fees and synthetic tokens.

Aave currently has around $34 billion in net deposits, while Lido has $33 billion. Together, the two account for 40% of the $166 billion deposited in DeFi protocols.

The uptick in deposits comes amid a broader resurgence in the DeFi market, whose TVL has more than doubled this year.

2024 Was Solana‚Äôs Best Year Yet. Can It Sustain the Momentum in 2025?

This year has been a transformative one for Solana. With a surge in developer activity, bold innovations in DePIN, and its ambitions to become a ‚Äúdecentralized Nasdaq,‚Äù the ecosystem is making waves. But are these changes enough to differentiate it from competitors like Ethereum and L2 solutions such as Base?

In this episode of Unchained‚Äôs podcast series, Lily Liu, president of the Solana Foundation, and Mert Mumtaz, CEO of Helius, join our founder and CEO Laura Shin to discuss how Solana is carving out its niche. They debate whether Base is a serious contender, why they‚Äôre not concerned about the 2025 token unlocks, and how Solana‚Äôs unique approach to MEV could shape its future. Plus, they tackle the ecosystem‚Äôs broader challenges and why they believe Solana‚Äôs vision will endure.

‚èÆÔ∏è Runes‚Äô transaction share on the Bitcoin network has dropped to new lows, sinking to just 1.67% of daily transactions ‚Äî a stark reversal from when the protocol accounted for more than half of Bitcoin transactions between April and November.

üß™ Decentralized Science protocol BIO Protocol has spun up a community proposal to expand its native token BIO to the Solana ecosystem. The proposal also calls for setting up cross-chain bridge infrastructure and allocating an additional 1% of funds from ecological incentives to establish a cross-chain liquidity pool.
